snippet: The government of Ecuador is letting Julian Assange, the founder of WikiLeaks, to remain indefinitely in its embassy in London as he seeks asylum.
abstract: Government of Ecuador says that it is prepared to allow WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange to remain in its embassy in London indefinitely under a type of humanitarian protection; Assange arrived at the embassy on June 19, seeking to avoid being sent to Sweden, where he is wanted for questioning over allegations that he sexually assaulted two women.

byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN and MAGGY AYALA
byline.contributor: William Neuman reported from Caracas, and Maggy Ayala from Quito, Ecuador. John F. Burns and Ravi Somaiya contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: The government of Ecuador is letting Julian Assange, the founder of WikiLeaks, to remain indefinitely in its embassy in London as he seeks asylum.

headline.seo: Ecuador to Let Julian Assange Stay in Its London Embassy
headline.main: Ecuador to Let Assange Stay in Its Embassy
headline.print_headline: Ecuador to Let Assange Stay In Its Embassy
